Estimate average within-group covariance matrices from a mixture covariance matrix

Source: R/mix_matrix.R
unmix_matrix.Rd

Estimate average within-group covariance matrices from a mixture covariance matrix

unmix_matrix(
  sigma_mat,
  mu_mat,
  p_vec,
  N = Inf,
  group_names = NULL,
  var_names = NULL
)

Arguments

sigma_mat

Mixture covariance matrix.
mu_mat

Matrix of mean parameters, with groups on the rows and variables on the columns.
p_vec

Vector of proportion of cases in each group.
N

Optional total sample size across all groups (used to compute unbiased covariance estimates).
group_names

Optional vector of group names.
var_names

Optional vector of variable names.

Value

List of within-group covariances and means.

Examples

out <- unmix_matrix(sigma_mat = reshape_vec2mat(.5, order = 2),
                    mu_mat = rbind(c(0, 0), c(.5, 1)),
                    p_vec =  c(.3, .7), N = 100)

## Result of unmix_matrix:
out

#> $N
#> [1] 100
#> 
#> $n_group
#> group_1 group_2 
#>      30      70 
#> 
#> $p_group
#> group_1 group_2 
#>     0.3     0.7 
#> 
#> $cov_total_unbiased
#>      Var1 Var2
#> Var1  1.0  0.5
#> Var2  0.5  1.0
#> 
#> $cov_total_ml
#>       Var1  Var2
#> Var1 0.990 0.495
#> Var2 0.495 0.990
#> 
#> $cov_group_unbiased
#> $cov_group_unbiased$group_1
#>           x1        x2
#> x1 0.9698276 0.4034483
#> x2 0.4034483 0.8068966
#> 
#> $cov_group_unbiased$group_2
#>           x1        x2
#> x1 0.9510870 0.3956522
#> x2 0.3956522 0.7913043
#> 
#> 
#> $cov_group_ml
#>        x1   x2
#> x1 0.9375 0.39
#> x2 0.3900 0.78
#> 
#> $means_raw
#>           x1  x2
#> group_1 0.00 0.0
#> group_2 0.50 1.0
#> Total   0.35 0.7
#> 
#> $means_centered
#>            x1   x2
#> group_1 -0.35 -0.7
#> group_2  0.15  0.3
#> Total    0.00  0.0
#> 

## Simulated data reproduce the total parameter matrix:
dat <- NULL
for(i in 1:2){
     dat <- rbind(dat, cbind(group = i,
                             data.frame(MASS::mvrnorm(n = round(out$p_group[i] * out$N),
                                                      mu = out$means_raw[i,],
                                                      Sigma = out$cov_group_unbiased[[i]],
                                                      empirical = TRUE))))
}
cov(dat[,-1])

#>     x1  x2
#> x1 1.0 0.5
#> x2 0.5 1.0
